message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.ST, cs.IT. 

The paper proposes a Bayesian approach for learning discriminative dictionaries for sparse representation of data, which is a common problem in machine learning and computer vision. The paper focuses on classification tasks and presents experiments for face and action recognition, object and scene-category classification. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition), and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper uses Bayesian methods and probabilistic models, which are also relevant to cs.ST (Statistics) and cs.IT (Information Theory).
